results.title: The Three Stooges. Vols. 11-13
results.brief_description: Compilation of three videos starring the Three Stooges in some of their funniest films. Titles include “Hokus pokus” (dir. Jules White); “Heavenly daze” (dir. Jules White); “I’m a monkey’s uncle” (dir. Jules White); “Booty & the beast” (dir. Jules White); “Flagpole jitters” (dir. Jules White); “Pardon my backfire” (dir. Jules White); “Scotch in Scotland” (dir. Jules White); “Pardon my clutch” (dir. Edward Bernds); “Cuckoo on a choo choo” (dir. Jules White). The Three Stooges consisted of Moe Howard, Shemp Howard and Larry Fine.

results.title: The Three Stooges. Vols 24-26
results.brief_description: Compilation of three videos starring the Three Stooges in some of their funniest films. Titles include “Nutty but nice” (dir. Jules White); Gripes, grunts & groans” (dir. Jack White); “Three little pirates (dir. Edward Bernds); “Horsing around” (dir. Jules White); “Hoofs and goofs” (dir. Jules White); “Flying saucer Daffey” (dir. Jules White); “Guns a poppin” (dir. Jules White); “Sweet and hot” (dir. Jules White); “Bubble & trouble” (1953). The Three Stooges consisted of Moe Howard, Shemp Howard and Larry Fine.

results.title: The Three robbers (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Tomi Urgerer, this animated tale is about three fierce robbers who terrify the countryside until they meet a little girl named Tiffany. Under Tiffany’s golden charm the robbers turn their gold to good use and all ends happily in this droll tale heightened by bold colourful illustrations.
results.description: Based on the story by Tomi Urgerer, this animated tale is about three fierce robbers who terrify the countryside until they meet a little girl named Tiffany. results.title: The Three musketeers
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Joe Roth, Roger Birnbaum and Stephen Herek
results.brief_description: This Disney adaptation of the classic 17th century French novel by Alexandre Dumas features Chris O’Donnell in the lead role of the swashbuckling hero D’Artagnan, a musketeer in the King’s guards in Paris. When D’Artagnan discovers that the scheming Cardinal Richelieu (Tim Curry) is plotting to oust the King from his throne, he joins up with three other musketeers - Athos (Kiefer Sutherland), Porthos (Oliver Platt), and Aramis (Charlie Sheen) - to protect King and country and thwart the unscrupulous Cardinal’s plans. Also stars Rebeccca De Mornay as Milady de Winter. Beautiful cinematography by Dean Semler and lavish costuming and set design.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Pictures, Joe Roth, Roger Birnbaum and Stephen Herek

When D’Artagnan discovers that the scheming Cardinal Richelieu (Tim Curry) is plotting to oust the King from his throne, he joins up with three other musketeers - Athos (Kiefer Sutherland), Porthos (Oliver Platt), and Aramis (Charlie Sheen) - to protect King and country and thwart the unscrupulous Cardinal’s plans. Also stars Rebeccca De Mornay as Milady de Winter. Beautiful cinematography by Dean Semler and lavish costuming and set design.

results.title: The Three monks (K)
results.brief_description: An animated story about co-operation in which three monks squabble over the chore of fetching water to put out the fire in their temple. Considers the benefit of teamwork as opposed to thinking only of oneself.

results.title: The Three little pigs (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Paul R. Gagne and Jan Mack
results.brief_description: The legendary story of the three pigs and the greedy, scheming wolf comes to glorious “huffing, puffing” life as the wolf tries his best to outsmart the pigs and at last meets his comeuppance. This favourite story features a lively narration by Ian Thompson. Based on the book by Erik Blegvad.
